{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3285225,"name":"Jim simpson","username":"JSIMPSO","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-15T22:38:07.785Z","cooked":"

Has anyone had troubles reading an ADI16470 on a roboRIO2 using the 2024 image?

The gyro (imu) works fine on a roboRIO1 but throws errors on a roboRIO2. A question was submitted in the NI forums here.

forums.ni.com – 15 Jan 24

roboRIO2 and ADI16470 gyro

We are having issues reading an ADI6470 gyro.   See the attached log screen shot.  The issue appears to only be occuring on a roboRIO2.   We have a roboRIO1 that can read the gyro without issue.   See attached...

The roboRIO1 has 23.x firmware. The roboRIO2 has 22.x firmware and it appears that it can’t be updated. The game tools were installed using the offline image. Not sure if this has anything to do with the issue, but it seemed worth pointing out…

Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-01-15T22:38:07.785Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":79.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":450354,"topic_slug":"roborio2-and-adi16470-gryo","display_username":"Jim simpson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://forums.ni.com/t5/Troubleshooting-Hardware/roboRIO2-and-ADI16470-gyro/m-p/4349092","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"roboRIO2 and ADI16470 gyro - NI Community","clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26698,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/roborio2-and-adi16470-gryo/450354/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3288356,"name":"Jim simpson","username":"JSIMPSO","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T22:29:46.225Z","cooked":"

It looks like our issue with the gyro (and with CTRE cancoders) may NOT be related to the image but rather related to needing to mass compile the project and related libraries. I’ll know more tonight after testing. I had to mass compile twice to get all the issues to disappear.

your second idea for the issue is probably the cause. before pigeons came back into stock we used a SPI AD gyro and had no issues on both 2023 and 2024 firmware versions on both rio1 and rio2
